body_html:
I know this issue has been beaten to death but I can't seem to figure out what I am doing wrong.

I am using a conda virtual environment with python 3.5.4
I have tensorflow-gpu 1.3 installed via pip install tensorflow-gpu
My CUDA is installed on my D:\ drive (D:\deeplearning\CUDA\v9.0)
I also downloaded cudnn 5.1 as well as cudnn 6 and both cudnn64_5.dll and cudnn64_6.dll are in the D:\deeplearning\CUDA\v9.0\bin folder

I have D:\deeplearning\CUDA\v9.0\bin set in my environment path
I also have a path to MSVCP140.DLL

When I run import tensorflow as tf I am still getting ImportError: No module named '_pywrap_tensorflow_internal'

I am not sure if it makes a difference but I do have CUDA 9 installed instead of CUDA 8 and visual studios 2017.
body_text:
I know this issue has been beaten to death but I can't seem to figure out what I am doing wrong.
I am using a conda virtual environment with python 3.5.4
I have tensorflow-gpu 1.3 installed via pip install tensorflow-gpu
My CUDA is installed on my D:\ drive (D:\deeplearning\CUDA\v9.0)
I also downloaded cudnn 5.1 as well as cudnn 6 and both cudnn64_5.dll and cudnn64_6.dll are in the D:\deeplearning\CUDA\v9.0\bin folder
I have D:\deeplearning\CUDA\v9.0\bin set in my environment path
I also have a path to MSVCP140.DLL
When I run import tensorflow as tf I am still getting  ImportError: No module named '_pywrap_tensorflow_internal'
I am not sure if it makes a difference but I do have CUDA 9 installed instead of CUDA 8 and visual studios 2017.
body:
I know this issue has been beaten to death but I can't seem to figure out what I am doing wrong.

I am using a conda virtual environment with python 3.5.4
I have tensorflow-gpu 1.3 installed via pip install tensorflow-gpu
My CUDA is installed on my D:\ drive (D:\deeplearning\CUDA\v9.0)
I also downloaded cudnn 5.1 as well as cudnn 6 and both cudnn64_5.dll and cudnn64_6.dll are in the D:\deeplearning\CUDA\v9.0\bin folder

I have D:\deeplearning\CUDA\v9.0\bin set in my environment path
I also have a path to MSVCP140.DLL

When I run import tensorflow as tf I am still getting  ImportError: No module named '_pywrap_tensorflow_internal'

I am not sure if it makes a difference but I do have CUDA 9 installed instead of CUDA 8 and visual studios 2017.
